Activity: Arrive at the office. Review schedule and prepare for the day. Check emails for urgent requests.
Review project documentation related to EHR collection and influenza trend analysis, focusing on clinical workflows. Prepare preliminary questions for clinical staff.

Meet with @clinlead-1 (Clinical Lead) to discuss the best approach for gathering feedback from physicians and nurses. Brainstorm specific questions to address current challenges and pain points in data entry and reporting.

Draft email invitation to physicians and nurses, @rn-1 @rn-2 @rn-3, requesting feedback on EHR usability, data collection clarity, and training effectiveness. Clearly state the purpose and benefits of their participation.

Prepare a structured feedback form (digital and paper versions) focusing on specific areas: ease of data entry, clarity of data fields, perceived value of training, and suggestions for improvement. Send draft to @clinlead-1 and @qatest-1 for review.

Review feedback on the feedback form from @clinlead-1 and @qatest-1. Make necessary revisions and finalize the forms. Distribute the forms via email and place physical copies in strategic locations (nurse stations, physician lounges).
Attend the regularly scheduled Project Meeting. Pay close attention to discussions around data quality issues, integration challenges, and potential roadblocks to EHR collection. Take detailed notes.

Analyze notes from the project meeting. Identify action items relevant to my role and prioritize them. Follow up with @itpm-1 (IT Project Manager) on a key decision discussed regarding data storage capacity.
Review initial responses to the feedback form. Identify trends and common themes. Prepare a preliminary summary to share with @clinlead-1 tomorrow.
Plan for tomorrow's tasks: Review the detailed schedule and prepare for the next day.
